item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says that Meta’s Llama models have hit 1B downloads
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In a brief message Tuesday morning on Threads, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the company’s “open” AI model family, Llama, hit 1 billion downloads. That’s up from 650 million downloads as of early December 2024 — a 153% increase over a roughly-three-month period. Llama, which powers Meta’s AI assistant, Meta AI, across the tech giant’s […]

item.title: Make your choice! Vote for the speaker you want to see at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
It’s time to make your voice heard. After receiving an overwhelming amount of applications for speakers at TechCrunch Sessions: AI, we have chosen six incredible finalists. TC Sessions: AI takes place on June 5 in Zellerbach Hall at UC Berkeley — and you have the power to decide who you want to take the stage […]

item.title: Coreshell has a plan to slash the price of American made batteries
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Rather than trying to beat Chinese companies, Coreshell attempting an end run, swapping graphite for its specially coated silicon.

item.title: Anthropic is reportedly prepping a voice mode for Claude
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
According to a report, AI startup Anthropic is working on voice capabilities for its AI-powered chatbot, Claude. The company’s chief product officer, Mike Krieger, told the Financial Times that Anthropic plans to launch experiences that allow users to talk to Anthropic’s AI models. “We are doing some work around how Claude for desktop evolves  [… […]

item.title: WhatsApp will soon limit number of broadcast messages users and businesses can send
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Chat platform WhatsApp said today that it will limit the number of broadcast messages individual users and businesses can send to curb spam on the app. In the coming weeks, the company will start testing limits on individual broadcast messages. Under these limits, WhatsApp will put a monthly limit on the number of broadcasts. While […]

item.title: Exist is a new social wellness app that wants to help middle-age users find community
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
A new iOS social wellness app called Exist wants to help middle-aged consumers connect and build meaningful communities with one another as they navigate their lives and the stresses that come with it. The app describes itself as the edgier cousin of Calm or Headspace, and its main feature is social journaling. The idea behind […]

item.title: Google plans to release new ‘open’ AI models for drug discovery
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
During a health-focused event in New York on Tuesday, Google announced that it’s developing a collection of “open” AI models for drug discovery called TxGemma. The AI models, which Google said will be released through its Health AI Developer Foundations program later this month, can understand both “regular text” and the structures of different “therapeutic […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google launches new healthcare-related features for Search, Android
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Google on Tuesday announced new products and features aimed at healthcare use cases, including improved overviews in Google Search for health queries, medical records APIs, and new health-focused “open” AI models. In Search, Google says it’s using AI and ranking systems to expand “knowledge panel” answers on thousands of health-related topics, and adding support for […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TurinTech reveals $20M in backing to fix problems in ‘vibe coding’
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
So-called “vibe coding” with LLM-driven tools like Cursor Composer — a term coined by renowned computer scientist Andrej Karpathy — describes a hands-off approach to writing code using Gen AI models, and it has really taken off recently. According to Y Combinator, one quarter of the startups in its latest batch relies on AI to […]

item.title: Apple loses appeal against Germany’s special abuse control for Big Tech
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Being a staggeringly successful big tech company does have some downsides: Apple has lost an appeal against a special abuse control regime that Germany’s competition watchdog applied to it last year. The iPhone maker can expect to continue to face bespoke competition controls in a major European market, in addition to other similar laws (such […]

item.title: Confirmed: Google buys Wiz for $32B to beef up in cloud security
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Google is making the biggest acquisition in its history. The company’s parent company Alphabet is buying Wiz, the cloud security startup, for $32 billion in an all-cash transaction. The deal has now been confirmed. A source described the transaction as a $33 billion deal previously. That includes the $1 billion that Google is paying out […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Nerdio nabs $500M to power virtual desktops on Azure
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Nerdio, a platform designed to simplify how companies deploy and manage Microsoft cloud technologies, has raised $500 million in a Series C round of funding. The Chicago-based startup says its valuation has now quadrupled since its Series B round two years ago, and is now firmly in unicorn territory — though the company wouldn’t reveal […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: YC-backed food supply startup Vendease restructures employees’ salaries
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
Y Combinator-backed Nigerian food procurement startup Vendease has changed its employee pay structure and is seeking fresh capital, TechCrunch has learned. This is after laying off 44% of its workforce — around 120 employees —last month, marking its second round of job cuts in five months. In the latest development, the startup has now replaced […]

item.title: GrubMarket raises $50M at $3.5B+ valuation to build AI for the $1 trillion food distribution industry
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
U.S. President Donald Trump’s wide-ranging tariff hikes are already resulting in growth forecasts being cut amid an uncertain public mood — all of which will inevitably impact the technology sector, too. On Tuesday, however, one food e-commerce startup, GrubMarket, seemed impervious to these macroeconomic concerns: it announced a new equity round of $50 million on […]

item.title: Google, Speedinvest back Kenya’s Leta, which uses AI to make logistics cheaper
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
African businesses pay up to four times the global average to transport goods. Nairobi-based logistics SaaS provider Leta wants to change that.

item.title: Waymo’s milestone SFO mapping permit comes with strings attached
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Waymo has been given permission to map roadways at the San Francisco International Airport (SFO) via a temporary permit — the first step in the Alphabet company’s bid to unlock a potentially lucrative use case for its robotaxis. The temporary permit, which was announced Monday evening by San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie, kicked off March […]

item.title: Google revives talks to acquire Wiz at higher valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin, Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Update: the deal is done at $32 billion, in cash. Read more here. Google’s parent company Alphabet is again in advanced talks to acquire cloud cybersecurity startup Wiz, a person familiar with the deal told TechCrunch. The two companies were close to securing a deal at a $23 billion valuation last summer, but the transaction […]

item.title: OpenAI exec leaves to found materials science startup
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Liam Fedus, OpenAI’s VP of research for post-training, is leaving the company to found a materials science AI startup. The Information initially reported Fedus’ plans. In a statement on X, Fedus confirmed the report and added a few additional details. “My undergrad was in physics and I’m keen to apply this technology there,” Fedus said […]

item.title: Intel could be in for significant changes as Lip-Bu Tan takes on CEO role
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Intel’s new CEO Lip-Bu Tan seems ready to get right to work to turn around the struggling company.  The semiconductor giant’s new executive is considering sweeping changes for the company’s chip manufacturing and AI strategies, according to Reuters, including cutting middle management staff and revamping the company’s approach to manufacturing chips. Tan reportedly told company […]

item.title: Rippling sues Deel, Deel denies ‘all legal wrongdoing,’ and Slack is the main witness
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
It’s gloves off in one of the more tense rivalries in the world of startups. HR company Rippling Monday morning announced a lawsuit against Deel, another big player in the same space. The dramatic 50-page complaint alleges racketeering, misappropriation of trade secrets, tortious interference, unfair competition, and aiding and abetting a breach of fiduciary duty. […]
